sentences.en: ‘I came out top in the test,’ he bragged.
sentences.cn: “我测验得了最高分。”他吹嘘道。

sentences.en: Don't brag about what you're going to do . Get something done.
sentences.cn: 先别吹, 做出具体成绩来再说.

sentences.en: Don't brag until you've got something out of them.
sentences.cn: 等到你能让他们拿点钱出来再自鸣得意吧.

sentences.en: He loved to talk big and brag about a variety of things to other people.
sentences.cn: 他喜欢说大话,很多事情都喜欢跟人乱掰一通.

sentences.en: He made a great brag of his ability.
He made brag of his skill.
Hung - chien said with a smile, " Don't brag.
sentences.cn: 鸿 渐 笑道: “ 你别吹.

sentences.en: I can't stand people who brag.
It is not in good form to brag of your learning.
sentences.cn: 吹嘘自己的学识是欠妥的。

sentences.en: Now you're bragging, darling. You know you don't need to brag.
sentences.cn: 这就是夸口, 亲爱的. 你明知道你不必吹.

sentences.en: Some people like to brag that they have cast - iron stomachs.
sentences.cn: 有些人总喜欢夸耀他们的胃口,说好得跟钢铸铁打的一般.

sentences.en: These are the people that have every right to brag and maybe be a bit arrogant, yet they remain humble.
sentences.cn: 这些人有理由吹嘘自己的成功，甚至理应有点自傲，但是他们仍然保持着低调的作风。

sentences.en: They like his slang and his brag and his blunders.
sentences.cn: 他们很喜欢听他说土话,吹牛皮或胡说八道.

sentences.en: We must never brag and boast.
You just love to brag about things beforehand. "
You've done nothing but brag around ever since you've been here. "
sentences.cn: 自从来这里以后,你什么也不干,就会自吹自擂. ”

trans.tran_cn: 勃莱格牌戏（简化的扑克牌戏）

trans.tran_en: to talk too proudly about what you have done, what you own etc – used to show disapproval
